title: Ticket #7666: condor_ssh_to_job should fully work with singularity
description:
When a job running inside singularity is connected to with condor_ssh_to_job, several things don't quite work today. Because we never want to assume anything about what might be inside the container, we launch the sshd outside the container, and have it run nsenter to launch a shell inside the container, with stdin/out/error magically connected to the ssh session.

However, the stock nsenter doesn't allocate a pty for the session, and the pty that ssh allocates gets lost when we enter the container, because singularity remounts /dev/pts on the inside.

Also, the environment variables set by the job are not reset inside the interactive shell. While we could set the ones that the starter knows about, singularity itself sets several extra environment variables which we don't know about, and may be of particular important when gpus are in play.

Also, we need to give nsneter a different set of command line options if we are entering a singularity container that was started by a non-setuid singularity. This is annoying, as we can't tell really if singularity is configured to be setuid or not.

So, we will write a replacement nsenter that fixes all these problems.
remarks:
2020-Jul-27 22:59:18 by jfrey:
Code Review

  • Eliminate duplicate call to findChildProc() in os_proc.cpp.

  • Eliminate redundant calls to getenv().

  • Can't we end up with two DISPLAY environment variables in envp? Can we trust that the first one in the list will win?

  • Shouldn't we not call ioctl(TIOCSWINSZ) if ioctl(TIOCGWINSZ) fails?

  • Blindly trusting that the grandchild pid will have all of the correct environment variables and other properties seems error prone when it can be a child of the original job process.
